intro: Noccaea zangezurica, commonly known as the Zangezur watercress, is a rare aquatic plant native to the Caspian Sea region. It thrives in freshwater environments, particularly in shallow, nutrient-rich waters. The plant has slender, ribbon-like leaves that are typically submerged or floating. Its small white flowers appear in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value. Noccaea zangezurica plays a vital role in maintaining the ecological balance of its habitat by providing food and shelter for aquatic life.
